definition: to spread/to display/to set up/(old) holder for door-knocker
plank bed/place to sleep/shop/store/(old) relay station
to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition

sentences.english: The top-down management support should not be confused with the rollout approach.
sentences.chinese: 自顶向下的管理支持不应该与铺展过程相混淆。

sentences.english: The product has excellent hang wall spreading property, fully role to each site.
sentences.chinese: 本品具有优异的挂壁铺展性，充分作用到每一个部位。

sentences.english: I have spread my dreams under your feet.
sentences.chinese: 就把我的梦铺展在你的脚下。

sentences.english: The jungle spread beneath him in a green velvet nap .
sentences.chinese: 丛林铺展在他的脚下，象一片绿丝绒那么毛茸茸的。

sentences.english: My colored season is spreads out all over in here.
sentences.chinese: 我的花季是在这里铺展开的。

sentences.english: Loading time had no significant effect on cells adhesive forces and spreading areas.
sentences.chinese: 加载时间对细胞的粘附力和铺展面积的影响不明显。

sentences.english: Miles upon miles to the east and southeast the desert unrolled itself .
sentences.chinese: 荒野绵延万里的向东面和东南面铺展开去。

sentences.english: The stretching increased cells adhesive forces and spreading areas.
sentences.chinese: 拉伸使成骨细胞的粘附力和铺展面积增加。

sentences.english: Susan can see, new life is in sight unfolding.
sentences.chinese: 苏珊仿佛看见，新的生活就在眼前铺展开来。

sentences.english: Fleecy clouds spread over the blue sky.
sentences.chinese: 蔚蓝的天空铺展着一片片的白云。

definition: to arrange/to spread out/to narrate in detail/to describe at great length/to elaborate
extremely vast/boundless/limitless/digressing/discursive/going off on tangents/straying far off topic
to stretch as far as the eye can see (idiom)
to ripple/to undulate/also written 蕩漾|荡漾
to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
